doc.title: Getting Rich in Iraq
doc.plot: The award-winning journalist and editor for Die ZEIT, Heike Faller, wants to get rich. In a daring attempt at personal investment in Iraq she shows no hint of fear when forging contacts with asset-strippers and credit crunch profiteers: Â»There is a way of understanding the complexity of post-war Iraqi society: what you do is buy shares there. And then you watch what happens to your own money. Investment means asking simple questions and providing simply personal answers in (apparently) complicated contexts: Anyone investing looks at a country in a different way because he literally "has stakes in it".
